title: GUI-based x86 assembly editor
content:
Is there a tool that disassembles x86 executables, presents it in a GUI where you can edit the assembly commands, and reassembles it when you want to save/patch the exe? All it would need is a tool that disassembles and reassembles x86 executables into a kind of text format .. like what 
ildump
does with .NET.

comments.text: Explorer Suite claims to have "PE Rebuilding" is this what I'm after? disassemble > edit > reassemble?

answers_data.content:
Use IDA Pro with pe_write.idc.
There's a full walk-through here: http://resources.infosecinstitute.com/applied-cracking-byte-patching-ida-pro/
Use IDA Pro. This is exactly the tool you're asking for. For patching the binary, use the options under the menu Edit -> Patch.

comments.text: How do you edit an opcode with IDA? I can't find any way of doing that.

Either in the hex viewer or via Edit -> Patch program -> Change byte/word or Assemble. My guess is that you're using "an old version" of IDA. In this case, you need to modify $IDA_DIR/cfg/idagui.cfg uncomenting the line that refers to the patch menu.

answers_data.content: Althought the 'GUI' is console based, I always used HIEW.
Ollydbg is a free tool - it's more of a debugger than a disassembler.
